newsitem.title: NORWAY: POLL-Norway July CPI seen up 2.52 pct yr/yr.
newsitem.headline: POLL-Norway July CPI seen up 2.52 pct yr/yr.

text.p: Norway's consumer prices (CPI) are expected to rise in July by an average 2.52 percent compared with July 1996, and to increase by 0.04 percent from June, according to a Reuter poll of 10 Norwegian and international analysts.
Year-on-year estimates for inflation ranged between 2.4 percent and 2.75 percent, while estimates for the month-on-month figure were between minus 0.1 percent and plus 0.28 percent.
For the year, analysts forecast inflation at 2.63 percent compared with projections of 2.55 percent in a July survey.
Norway's CPI is due to be released on August 11 at 0745 GMT.

Participants in the survey were Den norske Bank, Elcon Securities, Fondspartner, I.D.E.A., Handelsbanken, Norse Securities, Den Danske Bank, Christiania Bank og Kreditkassen, Sparebanken NOR and Unibank.
